There's a certain feeling in the air every fall, as the leaves turn from green to brown, as the air gets colder, and the days tick down until one specific October evening. Kids share superstitions and scary stories- how in one school bathroom stall, a ghostly janitor waits for those who's enter alone, how a long dead little leaguer still stalks the schools diamond after dark. Stores start to stock sweets and strange ensembles, macabre pieces of plastic and other disturbing decorations. People feel tricky, mischievous grins plastered on their faces as they prepare for a night of parties and pranks.

Yes, October 31st, Halloween night. A fun night for most; not for one person though. Call it bad luck, a haunting or a curse, but they experience an embarrassing night of humiliation and nudity.

What sort of night are they planning on having?

It's a night where people can get together, laughing and screaming at the outrageous, otherworldly outfits that they have on. Some of these parties are perfectly innocent- bobbing for apples, costume contests, trading assorted sweets- other parties are much the same, but with many less than innocent twists, on a night of pranks and provocativeness.

Man, Jack thought, slowly walking towards the front doors of his high school, this is going to suck, isn't it?.

It was a cold night- October 31st, to be exact, a night many people in East Weston had been looking forward to. See, not a lot happened in East Weston, it being a small, suburban town, so people took a lot of fun in what they could. Namely, holidays were a big thing for their community, and the high schools Halloween dance was probably one of the biggest events of the school year, behind prom.

Not that Jack had been to a Halloween dance before. He hadn't grown as attached to Halloween as everyone else apparently had. Still, for such a big deal, he felt he should go at least once. Plus as a senior, he could enjoy something most lowerclassmen couldn't- the after parties. He'd gladly endure the chaperoned school event for a chance to be invited to one of those. He was a nice enough guy- nice enough looking too, with a lean body and brown, fair hair. He figured if he rubbed enough elbows, he could get into one easy.

That being said, he felt kind of ridiculous, walking into his school at 7:30 pm, dressed as...

1111.content:
He had never really bought into the whole zombie trend that had manifested in pop culture over the past few years, but he didn't credit himself with an abundance of creativity either, so zombie it was! Still, he wasn't lazy. He didn't want to just be zombie Jack (nor did he want to ruin any of his own clothes), so he had gone to Goodwill and picked up some some duds that his friends assured him were "classic Romero".

Whatever that meant.

He had found an old grey blazer straight out of the 70s, a similarly anachronistic white button up shirt, a stodgy tie, and slacks with leg openings so big you get lost in them. He figured if he cut out a few jaw-shaped patches of fabric and liberally applied fake blood, he'd at last pass for an extra in a zombie flick.

He hadn't seen his most reliable companion, Tom, on the way into school- that wasn't a big surprise. Tom had been jabbering on and on about some elaborate costume that was sure to not only boost them the necessary rungs on the social ladder to get them into a party afterwards, but that the girls would be so awe-struck that they'd go anywhere and do anything with him. Tom would describe himself as a "visionary", "dreamer", or "iconoclast". Jack would describe him as a "schemer", "lech", or "person who doesn't know what iconoclast means", but they had a long standing and strong friendship dating back to before either of them could tell time. Tom got the pair into trouble pretty regularly, but Jack's relaxed charm would usually mitigate things a little.

Jack also had yet to see Sherry, the crush of his that dated back almost as long as his friendship with Tom. Sherry was whip-smart, gentle, driven, and had a warm smile that could melt Jack from 50 paces. Jack tried not to think of himself as a push-over, but any request she made of Jack got fulfilled, by hook or by crook. She had been elusive when Jack had asked what she would be going to the dance as, saying she wanted to surprise him, a tinge of rose in her cheeks. Jack nearly swallowed his gum when she said that.

Thoughts swirling through Jack's mind, he pushes the doors open to the school hallways. Cheesy Halloween songs taunt his ears from the nearby gym. As he walks through the corridors, a gaggle of some of the more well-liked students file out and head deeper into the school. Where does Jack's evening go from here?

1121.content:
The Henderson’s Halloween party is always a lot of fun, and Lana has assured her neighbors down the block that she intends on being there. She’s been telling them for months that she would probably show up as a vampire queen, but in recent weeks she’s come up with something a little more unusual that no one she knows will expect from her.

Lana fell in love with the idea of creating a sort of sexy werewolf costume, so she ordered an expensive full head wolf mask online. The mask is held in place by a zipper, and while on, all talking comes out as growls and roaring sounds and the eyes glow red. Next, she went to a great deal of trouble finding some synthetic fur the exact color of the mask, and spent a whole week leading up to Halloween diligently pasting the faux fur to a dark colored leotard. Along with some furry gloves and footies that go over her sneakers, she is finally ready to go. A furry tail attached to a belt with a small fanny pack (for her phone, ID, etc) finishes out her genius costume idea.

The party is already under way down the block, and it’s exciting to traipse her way down the street sans all clothing besides the skintight, furry leotard and face-hiding mask. Lana is enjoying the festive atmosphere of Halloween Night as kids scramble by in their cute costumes, cars slowly cruise by, and music and spooky sounds from several residences fills the air.

Someone across the street lights some lady-fingers fireworks, and their sudden pop-pop-popping gives Lana a start, so that her long legs get a little quivery for a second. It’s then that she notices how itchy and annoying the costume can become when she shivers, but it doesn’t feel THAT agitating, and besides, she’s there now, at the stoop leading up to the Henderson’s!

The party is in full swing, and she squeezes her way into the packed house. It’s chaos, and she guesses the whole neighborhood invited all their friends from the surrounding neighborhoods to come! Their whole big downstairs is packed wall-to-wall with revelers, young and old, and Lana grabs a drink off of a tray carried by a gaunt looking zombie butler. From what she can tell, the way down into their basement has a line moving slowly down there, and there are even more people all along the stairs and bannisters along the upstairs balcony. The bumping and jostling gets Lana all itchy again, and she politely tries to apologize when someone bumps her into someone else. She is next bumped right into a little boy, who holds up a huge fake spider at her which causes Lana to jump back in fear. Unfortunately, her ass pokes right into the crotch of Mr. Handley, a neighbor she always tries to avoid during the entire year, and especially on Halloween! She tries to apologize, but it comes out as a howl, and the laughing man dressed up as a prisoner with fake ball & chain only laughs and grabs her around the waist, saying, “Rawr yourself, darling!”. Fortunately, Lana realizes that he doesn’t recognize her, and she is about to bonk him in the crotch with her knee when his wife (as an Indian maiden) returns to his side, inquiring who his friend is.

Lana has already taken the opportunity of a gap in the crowd to dart away from her creep neighbor towards where she knows the downstairs bathroom is. Her skin is itching like mad now in the leotard, though her face and head aren’t, so she assumes it’s something about the leotard or the glue or fur that is getting to her. All she knows is, she really needs to strip out of this suit for a minute, to see if that relieves her itchiness any.

There is an interminable line for the downstairs bathroom, and Lana starts actively scratching the worst ticklish spots, but that only seems to make things worse. She even sees Jill Henderson scooting through the crowd with a tray, but Jill doesn’t recognize Lana when she tries to stop her, and only laughs at the great howling wolf costume before shifting out of Lana’s grip on her arm and into the tight crowd of costumed partiers. Lana then tries to remove her mask to speak to Jill…only the zipper seems to be stuck! “This can’t really be happening!”, thinks Lana. Now she begins yanking furiously at the zipper, so that the mask shifts, and she can't even see. She fights with all her might, but the zipper is jammed! Lana is quivering from the awful itchy sensations of the leotard, and rights the mask onn her head so she can at least see again.

She tries to get her phone out of the small belt pack, but hadn't counted on the unwieldy costume paws getting in the way. the costume feels increasingly prickly and uncomfortable now, and Lana is itching so bad, but can't scratch herself in this crowded house party without looking like some kind of nymphomaniac amongst people (some of whom she knows). 123.content:
"Come on..."

Eric was not happy.

"Yeah, no, I-- you have to give me some warning! You can't just expect me to..."

He'd been happy just earlier that day, but he'd been on the phone for about 15 minutes now, and his mood had soured more and more as the conversation had gone on.

"It's not that I wouldn't want to but I can't just- No, listen for a seco- Oh my God, fine! Okay? I'll come with!"

It was October 31st, about 7 o clock in the evening, and Eric could already feel that it was going to be a long night.

"Yeah, I'll see you in an hour, I guess. Okay, bye."

And with that, Eric flopped backwards onto his bed, a deep sigh escaping his lips. It wasn't that he didn't like Halloween, but he never really cared that much about it. But his friends seemed to like it a whole bunch; and this year they decided that he was going to enjoy it too, like it or not.

Eric probably wouldn't have minded of they'd given him a little more time to find something to go out in. Telling someone with no preparations at 6:45 to be ready to go out in full costume was not really fair, Eric thought. Still, not like he had much choice at this point. Joe, Sandra, and Allison had teamed up on him over speaker phone, apparently already partaking in some festivities. With all three of them shouting at him to come Trick or Treating with them, he had to cave eventually.

And now here he was. It was 7:12 now, so he had a little less than 50 minutes to throw something together for a costume.

Well, Eric thought, guess I better get started...

So, with time swiftly ticking by, Eric decided to:

Muttering to himself, Eric picked his phone back up and called his friends back.

"...Hey. You there?. Yeah, listen I- No, I'm not backing out. I'm not!.... I don't have a costume.... Well, yeah, considering I'm only coming out cause you guys wouldn't stop shouting at me, I'd say it kind of is your problem!.... Oh. You have something? Cool, alright... See you soon."

Eric put his phone back in his pocket. It was nice that he didn't have to deal with getting a costume in less than an hour, and that he had some free time to relax before being forced out. But... maybe he hadn't asked the best people for help. Joe was an alright guy, but didn't really think things through a lot. Sandy was probably capable of putting something together quick enough... but she had difficulty understanding what people would or would not like. If the costume was left up to Sandy, Eric had a feeling he wouldn't like it. And then there was Allison. Out of the four of them, Eric and Allison probably had the prickliest relationship. They got along fine most of the time, but they did like to make jabs at each other, give the other a hard time. He wouldn't put it past Allison to give him something just to screw with his head.

Still, in what felt like an eternity and yet no time at all, Eric heard his doorbell ringing. Sighing deeply, he came downstairs and opened his door to a cry of "Trick-or-Treat!" from his friends.

Joe was dressed pretty plainly for a Halloween costume- a baseball players outfit, with accompanying bat and mitt. Sandy was some sort of fairy; not quite Tinkerbell, but with the same sort of wings and dress. And finally, Allison, in some sort of spy suit. The gloves and boots were sleek, the catsuit tight, and even some sort of utility belt to complete the ensemble.

"So," Eric began, only to have a bag dropped at his feet. He surmised that his costume was inside, but when he looked into the bag, he was dismayed to find...

12333.content:
"You can't be serious," Eric said, grabbing a strip of fabric from within the bag. He lifted it higher and higher, slowly unraveling a massive roll of gauze.

"You try coming up with something good on such short notice," Allison said, reaching into the bag and removing a pair of scissors and a roll of tape, "you're lucky my mom works in a doctor's office or you'd be out of a costume."

"I'm not sure I have a costume now," Eric said back, "what am I supposed to do with all of this?"

"You'll be a mummy!" Sandy chirped.

"... so I'm just going to wrap myself up in this stuff?" Eric experimentally wound a length of it along his arm. On top of his sleeve, not only was it odd looking and uneven, but it was incredibly uncomfortable, even just with a couple of layers. "I don't think it's really going to work like this."

"Well, yeah," Allison said, "it'd probably be way too hard to move if you wrapped it over your clothes."

"So what do you want me to do then?" Eric asked. In response, Allison raised an eyebrow, Joe looked away and coughed into his hand, while Sandy just looked down and blushed. It took Eric a second to get the implication.

"Woah! No way!" Eric shouted, dropping the bandage like it had caught fire. "I'd wear this stuff out with you guys but not if that's all I'm wearing!"

"Calm down, you big baby!" Allison started, gathering up the discarded gauze, "no one said you had to go that far," she gave Eric a once over and snickered when he gave her a weird look. "Just, like, down to your boxers or something."

"That's still a little more than I'd really like...."

"Ah, c'mon, man," Joe started, "it'll be fun! This Holiday is all about looking weird and goofy! The point of it is to go out wearing either way more or way less than you're supposed to normally."

"If you don't want to Eric, it's alright," Sandy offered, looking disappointed but still smiling, "but it'll be fun! We promise!"

Eric sighed, looking from friend to friend to friend, to the bag on the floor. He shut his eyes, rolled his head back, and gave his answer.....

------------------------


"Stupid, hate these bandages," Eric muttered to himself in his room. He was standing there, a pair of sneakers on and a pair of boxers on, but bare besides, desperately trying to wind the bandages around his arm, but every time he let go to grab a piece of tape or snip something with the scissors, the gauze would loosen under just one hand.

"Yeah, hurry up," Allison said, "it took long enough to get you to come out, lets just do it already!"

"Hang on!" Eric shouted back, "It's hard to do this with one pair of hands." He struggled for a second longer, but heard Allison snickering from the hallway.

"You need some help?" she asked.

"Not from you!" Eric shot back.

"What about me?" Joe asked.

Eric paused for a moment considering the offer. "Eh..." If it was Joe, he could trust him to be cool about it, but he wasn't sure Joe would have a better time than he was having. Allison, on the other hand, was a bit better with her hands. Of course, she'd give him hell the whole time about being almost naked, but it would at least get over quicker than if Joe helped, or if he kept doing it himself. In the end...

Knock! Knock! Knock!

Well, I guess nap time’s over.

Molly let her eyes open to take in the darkness that filled the janitor closet 2-B. The twenty-one-year old stood up and tried to maneuver around the various cleaning supplies as she stretched her muscles. 12:42 Pm October 31st

The good thing about Halloween: management was obsessed with the holiday and found no “viable” means to stay open till the usual hour when everyone could be preparing to go out trick-or-treating. This allowed Molly to spend time with her friends, receive free candy, and get a couple more hours of sleep for the following day. The bad thing about Halloween: management still worked their employees like dogs until hours before the festivities. This prevented the twenty-one-year old from finding a good costume, or any costume for that matter, as well as the doctor-recommend amount of sleep that a young woman should have. This behavior was par for the course. Overtime was included, but the work the employees had to do was insane and slacking off was not tolerated which was rather comical since the brunette started using room 2-B for that very purpose back in July. Most people quit after two months from the stress. The one who stayed either were psychotic or, like Molly, had nothing better to do.

I should go back to college.

Knock! Knock! Knock!

Three more knocks-the signal for second warning. Molly found it best to vacate the janitor closet for the time being. The woman grabbed hold of the door knob as she thought back to her dilemma for the evening. No costume meant no trick-or-treating, no free candy and no spending time with her friends tonight of all nights. She shrugged to herself and spoke aloud, “Eh..... I could just rip something off here.”

12513.content:
As it turns out, the food service industry was about as glamorous as could be expected. Maybe less, considering one of the waitresses had just walked out from the janitor's closet she'd been sleeping in. But Molly didn't dwell on that for too long; she had costume options to consider.

'Course, her options were limited. As nice as Bertacelli's was, or at least looked to patrons, it was still just some restaurant. Not really a good place to find a creative outfit; white shirt and black slacks on every last member of the waitstaff. Sure enough, as she walked through the hall between the kitchens and dining area, it was pretty much the only outfit she could see. She gave a grateful nod to the waitress who alerted her, and a slightly more forced nod to the assistant manager she'd been warned about as he rounded the corner, coming from the kitchens. She waited until he had passed to wince at the sudden fluorescent lighting, only to wince more as she stepped out into the dining area and was met with the one thing worse to a person who'd just exited a pitch black room- natural light.

Friggin' place really needed to be open-air? Molly groaned inwardly as her eyes adjusted to the mid-day Sun. The whole 'gimmick' of the place was that you could eat out under the sky. A great idea, except for the bugs, birds, finicky weather, and scenic sights and smells of the roads that were just next to the building.

As she went into auto-pilo, having long since reached the perfect amount of focus/lack thereof to be able to think between orders, she continued to list the problems of finding a costume to herself. Next up was the issue of size.

Height was an issue- she was by far the tallest of the female staff, and taller than pretty much all of the guys. Then came the issue if muscle mass. She wasn't body-builder or anything, but Molly was no slouch when it came to her exercising. It was one of the few things she could call a hobby, honestly. But the burden of her bulk was apparent whenever she tried to find clothes. Toned muscle could still make an hourglass figure, sure, even if the curves are more like hard edges. But they'd still strain any seams sewed for a slightly smaller woman.

So with those thoughts in mind, and a tray of drinks in hand, Molly started coming up with options. Assuming the kitchen staff today was the good staff, they wouldn't mind her grabbing an outfit if she wanted to be a chef. Then there was the singers. It was a more recent development for the establishment; a lady in a cocktail dress singing each nigh tended to bring in more business around cocktail hour. Assuming she could talk to one of the singers at the end of her shift, she might be able to convince them to lend her a dress. Then all she'd have to worry about was fitting into the thing.

And of all that failed, well... A bed sheet ghost wasn't exactly the most creative costume in the world, but it was something. Molly figured a tablecloth ghost might work just as well.

As the minutes slowly ticked by, Molly decided she would go out tonight...

However, the ginger wanted to call the entire thing off as she glared at her mother who continued to hold Francine’s supposed attire by its hanger.

Grinning from ear to ear, her mother asked “So, what do you think?”

The redhead could only respond by throwing the first object she could grab at her mother which happened to be her dress shirt from earlier today, reminding Francine that she was only wearing a bra from the waist up.

Trying to hide her blush for new reasons, Francine snapped. “WHY WOULD YOU EVEN THINK THAT I WOULD WEAR THIS!?!?”

Her mother’s smile began to fall, clearly taken aback by the volume change in her daughter’s voice, but she calmly asked “Doesn’t this fit your criteria?”

Francine glanced back at the outfit another time. The twenty-year old requested her mother to find a Halloween costume for her as she studied for her midterms. While the ginger had gained many acquaintances during her time at college, she was an outsider in every social circle until she met a few classmates nearly two years her junior though they sometimes acted like they were just entering high school. The classmates in question had been close friends for nine years yet they welcomed Francine with open arms. They were also hopeless in every academic activity they attempted which might have been a reason for Francine’s current companionship but she really didn’t care. It was nice to chat with them during their off-hours and to have people listen to her opinions that didn’t revolve around calculus. Francine took every opportunity to bond with them and this year’s Halloween would be no different. However, studies came first which was why the ginger relied on her mother for the costume hunt with the guidelines she provided. It needed to be interesting in its design, have some history behind it and be a little daring to Francine’s standards.

The twenty-year old couldn’t outright say ‘no’ to her mother’s inquiry. Her outfit was interesting to say the least and most certainly daring but the only sense of history that Francine could see was the thin layer of dust on every square inch of fabric.

The redhead began to pick her teeth, groaning from the question that would soon come out of her mouth. “How exactly is this related to history?”

Francine’s mother snorted a little before saying, “Well, it’s related to our history. I met your father while wearing this!”

“EWW,” Francine shouted. She resisted the urge to push her mother out of the room as her actions might result in that retched outfit brushing up against her bare skin.

Holding the costume as if it were a shield, Francine’s mother protested, “Don’t worry! I didn’t do anything naughty in this and it’s been washed several times since anyway. I just thought it matched what you were looking for. Plus......... It would mean a lot to me if you’d wear it.”

Francine wanted to turn away from her mother but their eyes were locked. Her mother still gave the hopeful grin she was known for wearing, a little toned down from her grin earlier. Francine really didn’t want to give in so easily but that smile was also known for how it could make anyone drown in guilt and Francine was no exception. The redhead also began to feel guilty about the one guideline she omitted from her request: perfection. It’s understandable as to why someone would leave this out when hunting for a costume-How do you explain ‘perfection’ to another person?- yet Francine still hoped her mother would follow her unspoken rule. Unsurprisingly, her choice was far from perfect and the twenty-year old did not feel like she had the right to blame her. Her face began to heat up as she mentally beat herself over with a hockey stick and imagined what her colleagues would say tonight. Could it be deemed childish to worry so much over a simple costume? Possibly but Francine wanted this chance to finally receive what she considered a “friend” for the first time since tenth grade. The twenty-year old believed that most people would side with her once they saw her mother’s choice:

She lay disoriented on her back, prank tools scattered around her. Her shorts still stuck as stubbornly as ever, but she is free of them.

13213113221.content:
After some consideration, Lindsey decides to retrieve the camera. Those pictures are her objective for the night and it's not like the camera is cheap. If she loses it now, she will have to save all year to buy a new one.

Firm in her resolve, Lindsey scans for people nearby. A few trick-or-treaters are going from house to house. Most of them seem more interested in their candy than half-naked ninjas sneaking around. Regardless, getting the camera will require making a full trip across the open street and there are no proper hiding places on the other side. If someone spots her, things are going to get complicated real fast. The trip across the street to prank unsuspecting Tina seemed so easy now. She used to be mostly hidden in her black costume in the shadows, but now even the moonlight made her fair skin look as though it was glowing against the dark night.

The people around are scarce and they all are occupied for the moment. Looks like it is now or never. If Lindsey doesn't act now, she might as well just give up on her night of mischief.

Lindsey takes a deep breath and vaults over the bush in front of her. She sprints towards the camera and swoops her arm down to grab it. Skidding to a stop, she changes direction back towards her comfortable hiding spot. Glaring left and right as she runs, no one has torn their attention from their candy collection to notice Lindsey yet. Reaching the protected hedge again, Lindsey vaulted back over and sat down to catch her breath.

She waited in silence, listening for any curious people that had heard or caught a glimpse of her. If anyone has noticed, no one is searching now, so it seems she is safe for the moment. Lindsey sighs in relief and shudders from the adrenaline still running through her veins.

Flipping on the camera, Lindsey examines any damage. It has a few scuffs from being thrown so far, but it is still completely functional as far as she can tell. A smirk stretches across Lindsey's face behind her mask. Things are about to turn around for her. Reaching into her bra, she pulls out her thin cellphone. It may not be the most comfortable place for it, but if worst comes to worst, a cellphone is imperative to getting out of a bad situation.

Lindsey pops out the tiny micro SD card from the camera and into her phone. There they are, plenty of clear shots of the Batgir's exposed backside under the streetlamp. With a few checks through the online school registry, club assignments, and calling in on a favor an acquaintance owed her, she finds Tina's contact information.

Moments later, Lindsey's sends her ultimatum to Tina: "Bring that top back to where you stole it from immediately unless you want these images in the hands of everyone in school. Don't try bringing anyone else, I won't hesitate to send these. You have five minutes."

Now all Lindsey has to do is wait. Tina doesn't seem like a very cunning individual. Lindsey believes the Batgirl won't hesitate to come running back when her dignity is threatened, but does Tina really have all that much to lose?

Finally, Lindsey spots her reverse prankster in the distance, but something seems off.

132131132211.content:
To Lindsey's dismay, Tina is not alone. Beside her are a two costumed companions. To her left is a girl in a red top, yellow belt, green tights, green gloves, a yellow cape and thin black superhero mask. The R on her top and belt complete the girl's Robin costume. To Tina's right is a girl clad in a black bodysuit and matching mask. The cat ears adorning her mask give away the girl's costume as that of Catwoman. Tina had been waiting for her friends dressed appropriately as other Batman characters.

This is the worst case scenario for Lindsey. She had only intended to intimidate Tina to get her clothing back and get back to her pranks. At this rate, she isn't going to get her top back and she can't even run away.

"It was over this way Jess," Tina explains to her friends.

"We'll see if our little ninja is so sneaky when she's the one being threatened," the girl in the Catwoman costume responds.

"Don't you worry Tina, even if people get those pictures get sent out, the one she sent you doesn't even look that revealing," the female Robin adds.

Jess speaks up again, "Don't be so pessimistic Riley. There's no way those pictures are getting out. That's the problem with blackmail like this. If she sends them out, she has no bargaining power. If she intends on actually getting her clothing back, she'll be stuck here."

While the trio converses, Lindsey is wracking her brain for a way out of this. If she stays here, she's bound to be found. But if she runs, there's no way she can reliably escape all three of them, not to mention her state of attire. If she had even a moment, she could a run for the backyard of the house behind her. Lindsey could see a fence around the edge of the house. Can she use the tools she still has left to cause enough of a distraction to escape? Perhaps it would be better just to bargain with the girls. It was only a harmless prank to begin with. Maybe they would be willing to work with her?
132131132211.title: She's not alone

choices: Find a place to hide
Keep running
1321311322111.content:
Lindsey only has a moment to craft her distraction. She cuts out the longest piece of tripwire she can from the bushes and ties it to the release on the noisemaker. The trio is stopped momentarily examining Tina's cape stuck to the streetlamp.

"Here we go," Tina whispers to herself as she gives her damaged smoke bomb a forceful roll towards the three girls. The small canister bumped into Riley's green shoe. The damaged smoke bomb had failed to detonate. Lindsey panics as the costumed girl picked up the strange object to get a better look at it. Tina looked over to see what Riley had stumbled across.

"Wait is that...?" Tina started to inquire before Riley started pulling at the tab on top of the canister.

Smoke burst out of the tiny can, blinding the three girls and leaving them in a state of disarray. When Lindsey saw this, she threw the noisemaker to the side and pulled hard on the string, setting off a loud bang while she ran the opposite direction. Hopefully that will be enough to throw them off her track. She sprints frantically towards the fence. No reason to look back now, if the trio sees her, there's no getting away anyway.

Lindsey reaches the wooden fence and grasps the top with both hands. She pulls herself up, using her feet to help make the height. Feet on top of the fence, she leaps into the safety of the dark house's backyard...

...and directly into a swimming pool. Cold water greets Lindsey's entrance into the backyard. The disoriented mischief maker emerges from the pool gasping for air. She held her soaked mask in her hand as she had torn it off to help find her way to the surface. She pulls herself out of the pool and lies down to catch her breath.

Lindsey hears Jess's voice, "Did you hear that? I thought the Stevensons were out of town."

It looks like Lindsey won't have any time to rest, and it looks like she won't be using her phone any time soon either. It won't be long until the girls find a way back here, Lindsey keep hopping backyards, but to get home, she would need to cross a major intersection, and she's already tiring out from her sprinting, jumping, and swimming after a long day of school. She could try to hide. There's a shed in the backyard and it's possible one of the doors or windows is open on the back of the house.
1321311322111.title: Create a distraction

choices: Look for a way into the house
Hide in the shed
13213113221111.content: Lindsey needs a moment to rest. The shed is a reasonable hiding spot. She could lock the door or at least brace it from the inside to keep her pursuers away. However, if she could get into the house, she would not only be safe, she could borrow some clothes. She would be killing two birds with one stone! Still, breaking into someone's house isn't quite as innocent as her pranks.
13213113221111.title: Find a place to hide

choices: Go after someone else's costume
Paint some clothes on
132131132211111.content:
Lindsey searches jiggles the handle of the back door, but it's not about to open. Giving up on the door, she starts pulling on windows. None of them are even budging. Lindsey starts to get frantic as the voices of the three girls get closer.

Finally, a window opens for her. She throws herself inside and quickly shuts the window. After a few minutes pass, Lindsey has calmed down and observes her surroundings. She's in a bathroom on the first floor. Lindsey stands up and examines the shower.

"Well as long as I'm here, it wouldn't hurt to rinse off," Lindsey speaks to herself as she opens the shower curtain.

She starts running the water while she strips off her few pieces of clothing. She is glad that she will once again be fully clothed after this. Lindsey steps into the hot shower and starts scrubbing away at the dirt and residues on her skin from her mischief so far. She finds a convenient bottle of body wash in the shower, some tangerine scented soap. After finishing her short shower, Lindsey steps out and finds a green towel folded on the counter and begins to dry herself. Now she could go search for some reasonable clothing withing the house.

Something sounds odd though. Are those footsteps? And they seem to be getting closer. But no one should be here, the girls even pointed that out. Then it hit Lindsey. The strange car in the driveway. The Stevensons may be gone, but they must have hired someone to watch their house!

In a panic, Lindsey throws the window open and vaults out. She slams it shut and runs around the corner of the building.

Seconds later, the light in the bathroom flicks on. Someone comes to the window and opens it. They scan outside the window, but don't find anything.

"Weird," the person says to themselves before closing the window. A soft click makes Lindsey's heart skip a beat in fear. Waiting until the light has gone off and the person is gone, she returns to the window to confirm her fears. The window is locked. This could not be worse. Now Lindsey was not only unmasked, but also only clad in a green towel. How in the world is she supposed to get home?

Lindsey picks up her black tube of paint previously forgotten in the backyard, not that it is of any use to her now. Climbing fences is much riskier now, but going back to the street would be begging for trouble now that her face is uncovered. Not to mention that the costumed trio could still be around searching for her.

Then again, her plan from the start was to prank people. If she is careful, maybe she could simply steal someone else's costume. Her luck has been so awful this evening, it is bound to turn around anyway. But maybe taking more extra risk isn't such a good idea. Staring at the tube of black paint, Lindsey started to get a crazy idea. She could paint herself to look like she is wearing something. In the dark of the night, as long as she never got close to anyone, no one would probably notice, but that would require leaving the towel - her only cover - behind.

What should Lindsey do?
132131132211111.title: Look for a way into the house

choices: Go after the costume
Ask Ella for help
1321311322111111.content:
There's no way Lindsey is about to give up her towel by choice. Besides, she came out here for one reason alone: to pull some amazing pranks. The night is still young. She's just been in a streak of bad luck. It can't go on forever. She'll nab some unsuspecting person's costume and be back on top.

Lindsey approached the fence where she entered the yard and pulled herself up to scan the area. The coast is clear as far as she can tell. Reluctantly, she undoes her towel from her body and removes it. She isn't about to lose it climbing over. She balls it up and tosses it and her waterlogged phone over the fence before hoisting herself up. This time Lindsey climbs down gently, memories of her accidental dive into a dark pool still fresh on her mind. She picks up her towel and wrapped it back around herself.

Lindsey returns to her hiding spot guarded by the surrounding hedge. When she first arrived here, she had a full costume on, now none of it remains. The brisk October breeze picking up isn't about to let Lindsey forget either. She shivers each time the wind brushes across her still damp skin.

The towel clad prankster diligently searches for a new victim. People stroll by here and there. One person comes by in an impressive set of power armor. Stealing that would be way much too difficult. Another comes by in a bare-chested action hero costume. Lindsey isn't about to put in all the effort to steal that when it wouldn't even cover her whole body.

Then she sees a girl sitting on the corner of the curb. If the green getup wasn't enough to tell, the pointed green cap made this an obviously a Link costume. White tights, a matching undershirt, and some a prop sword and shield complete the simple costume. When the girl takes a glance to the side, Lindsey recognizes her.

It's Ella from her math class. Unfortunately, Ella will definitely recognize Lindsey face if she's caught. On the other hand, Ella might be willing to help her. Surely she's over the swimsuit incident by now.
1321311322111111.title: Go after someone else's costume

choices: A true prankster can't quit now
Call it a night and head home
13213113221111111.content:
After a moment of thought, Lindsey goes over her plan carefully. Ella's hat looks loose. If Lindsey pulls it down, Ella will be blinded for a moment. While she is disoriented, Lindsey will pull the green tunic off the girl's body. That's all good, but there is an obvious flaw. There is no way Lindsey can get away in the moment Ella is blinded. to solve that, Lindsey will pull Ella's over her head. That should keep her occupied long enough for a reasonable escape around the corner.

Armed with a plan, Lindsey is ready to go. She carefully leaves her comfortable hideout and approaches Ella from behind. She sets down her phone and reacquired camera beside her for easy pick up during her escape.

Lindsey slowly reaches her arms out and yanks Ella's hat down as hard as she can. Without breaking motion, Lindsey's hands fly downwards and grasp the hem of the green tunic. By the time Ella realizes what is happening, the tunic is sliding over her arms and she reaches down to start pulling her oversized hat off her head. Suddenly, Ella's hand is stuck to her head as Lindsey wrenches her stretchy undershirt back.

Mission accomplished, Lindsey stands up and takes one step forward before she trips and falls. Ella had given up on fixing her undershirt and hat and is gripping Lindsey's angle tightly. Lindsey attempted to shake the girl off, but Ella held fast. If Lindsey doesn't do something, Ella is going to get her other arm out of that tangle soon.

Thinking fast, Lindsey shoves the Ella's shoulder down and straddles her exposed midriff. Maybe if Ella were a bit more frantic, she would let go? Lindsey pulls of Ella's boots while she kicks and pulls on her leg. Lindsey hangs on and moves on to the tights. It's not until Ella's tights are completely removed and her panties are on their way down that she finally lets go. Without any hesitation, Lindsey hops up just in time for Ella to get her arm free and reach back up. Her hands miss Lindsey, but catch the towel hanging from her body. One forceful pull is all it takes to leave Lindsey naked.

Red faced but free, Lindsey grabs the tunic, the tights, her phone, and her camera, only stopping for a second to take a picture for posterity. Sprinting away, she looks back to see Ella uncovering her face and tripping on the panties around her knees. Looks like Lindsey's luck might be turning around after all.

Lindsey stops around the corner of a house to don the clothing she had made off with. Ella is a somewhat petite girl, so the clothing isn't the best fit, but it's passable and it's still way better than nothing. Lindsey is thankful to be covered again. The white tights don't cover much. The extra stretching and the moisture on her legs isn't helping that, but the tunic will keep her decent regardless. Even without the tunic, someone would need to be fairly close to see she isn't wearing any panties. Her lack of a bra, on the other hand, is somewhat obvious. Her nipples are clearly visible poking through the thin fabric.

Oh well, she can always steal something else now that her options aren't so limited. The question is whether it's better to strike when the iron is hot or to quit while she's still ahead. Two successful pranks is a okay night, but she'll have to wait a whole year for this chance again. She may have four pursuers now, but three of them only knew her by costume.
13213113221111111.title: Go after the costume

choices: Vex the witch, but mind the broom.
Go for the gold with Wonder Woman
132131132211111111.content:
So the night was not really going how Lindsey had hoped. She was out of tools beyond her camera and a tube of paint, she'd been stripped naked and forced to take I'll-fitting replacements from a target, and there was a good chance she had some angry trick-or-treaters out for revenge.

But Lindsey wasn't about to let that get her down! She would just have to be better. And, well, considering the bright white and green clothes, a lot stealthier. The first thing would be to put a little distance between where she was (and where her half-naked quarries might still be looking for her) and her next target. It wasn't too difficult to get by; staying away from the streetlights and close to the shrubs and trees, acting natural when passing the occasional passerby, and doing her best to ignore the breeze that played at the edge of her tunic, chilled the skin under her still damp tights, and made her nipples under the fabric that much harder to miss.

Once she was a couple blocks over, Lindsey was satisfied she had a new hunting ground, as it were. It was a dark little cul-de-sac, only really lit by the front-lights of the houses around it, which suited her just fine. Plus, Lindsey had two targets to choose from; one, a tall girl dressed simply, a black witches dress and hat accented with purple highlights across the fabric and in her hair. An unsuspecting target for sure, slowly making her way out of the cul-de-sac,and Lindsey wouldn't mind adding a bit of black back into her outfit... But that broom she was carrying would be something to look out for.

On her way in was an older woman, dressed in the familiar red, blue, and gold of Wonder Woman. She was sort of familiar looking; a teacher? Lindsey couldn't get a perfect look at her face, but if she could put one over on a teacher she had to take that chance, right?

Either way, she'd need to work quick; the witch was leaving the block, and Wonder Woman was approaching one of the houses. She'd just have to pick one and hope she didn't attract the attention of the other while she worked.
132131132211111111.title: A true prankster can't quit now

choices: Fess up to the pranks
Make a run for it
Weave a web of lies
1321311322111111111.content:
Lindsey isn't too interested in taking on a fish as big as a teacher without any tools, so she turns her attention toward the slender witch.

Her phone still waterlogged, Lindsey will have to pull this one off without any outside help again. Considering the witch's costume, the item Lindsey would most like to acquire is the long black cloak the girl is wearing over her dress. But simply stealing the cloak and running for it isn't a very solid plan. Lindsey is fast, but for all she knows, this girl could be a track champ.

She needs to get a bit more creative. Lindsey is great at sneaking up on people. This girl may not have anything easy to pull over her head, but Lindsey could sure get under her dress and then panties would be an easy target. Now Lindsey's plan was starting to come together. She goes big or goes home and she's not about to go home. If worst comes to worst, she'll have the panties to bargain with.

Plan finished, Lindsey works her way around the cul-de-sac to the witch. She tucks her phone and camera into the waistband of her tights. The long-brimmed hat also aids in concealing the trickster from the peripheral. As Lindsey nears the witch, she crouches further to prepare herself.

Before the witch can assess the situation, she can feel hands grabbing at her hips. Lindsey tears the girl's feet off the ground to remove her prize and crawls through her victim's stumbling legs.

CRACK

The sound of the broom slamming down on Lindsey's echoes through the cul-de-sac. The world is still spinning for Lindsey as she is picked up by the collar of her tunic. When her vision finally clears, she is a foot off the ground and staring straight into two angry green eyes.

"Pretty good prank, wouldn't you admit?" Lindsey tries to placate, holding up her hands with the pair of panties still looped around her fingers.

From the side, a familiar character approaches, "What's going on over here?"

Lindsey can see it's Wonder Woman approaching. And with a closer look at her face, is that her phys ed teacher?

Getting a closer look at the situation, the teacher gasps, "Lindsey, did you take that girl's panties?" She takes a hard look at Lindsey's costume, "And I just ran into poor Ella walking home half-naked and crying after someone stole her costume."

"Sounds like I've caught a rat," the witch interjects.

This turned out worse than Lindsey could have imagined. The witch, she could've handled, but she didn't take the teacher into account when planning. On the bright side, the teacher should be reasonable enough if she apologizes though, right? She's a professional, and this is outside of school so Lindsey can't even get detention.
1321311322111111111.title: Vex the witch, but mind the broom.

choices: The girls want Lindsey's underwear
The girls want something else
132131132211112.content:
Short on time, Lindsey goes straight for the shed. She doesn't know how long it would be until the girls found her, and there may be no way into the house anyway.

She sprints towards the tiny wooden building. Pulling the door open, she jumps inside. Lindsey slams the door shut and fumbles around trying to lock it. A relieving click confirms she is finally safe. The girls will probably just assume the Stevensons left it locked.

Footsteps can be heard outside the shed. Three girls are walking across the grassy yard. With more of her confidence back, Lindsey ignores the sounds outside and pulls out her phone to observe the damage. She's never seen any kind of water-resistance advertised for this phone. It may be time to assume the worst for the thing. But like magic, the phone starts right up when she presses the button.

It has become strangely quiet outside, but Lindsey is too focused to notice anything.

Lindsey is baffled. She didn't think it would be unharmed in her wildest dreams. That's technology for you these days.

Her awe is short-lived however, as her phone starts ringing loudly through the shed. Lindsey drops the phone, but snatches it back up and taps to answer as quickly as she dropped it. She waits for a response on the other end, heart still racing in shock.

Lindsey only hears two words, "Found you."

The words hadn't come from the phone, but rather the other side of the shed door.

"We hear you did some mean things to our friend and heard you are planning to do some more. Do you want to have a chat with us?"

Lindsey is so confused. How did they get her phone number?

"You know, if you're going to try to blackmail someone, you should probably not use your own phone to do it."

Lindsey feels so stupid for making such an obvious mistake, but maybe that means the girls still don't know her identity.

"And who goes around with their name written on the inside of her clothes anyway?" The girl pulls up the end of the top on Tina and reads aloud, "Right here, it says property of Lindsey. Right next to a phone number and address to return it. You should really be more careful with this kind of thing."

Lindsey cursed silently at herself. Why does her mother have to write this kind of crap in her stuff. Looks like it's time Lindsey does her own laundry.

"So I tell you what miss class prankster, we're fun people, and we love a good prank. So maybe we can make a deal."

A bead of sweat rolls down Lindsey's cheek as she listens.
132131132211112.title: Hide in the shed

choices: Search for a way into the house
Look for other options
1321311322111121.content:
"If you hand over your phone and your underwear, we'll let you off the hook this time."

The words seemingly resonated through the shed around Lindsey. Her underwear? The trapped girl finally spoke up, nothing left to lose, "But if I give you my underwear, I'll be naked!"

The girl outside snickered, "It's better than doing whatever we like to you is it not?"

Lindsey already knew she didn't have a choice. There is no running away from here. The three girls outside will never let her run past them. But on the other hand, maybe this isn't so bad. With this offer, she actually has a chance to get out of this safely.

Not putting any more thought into it, Lindsey strips herself of her matching black bra and panties. And reaches a slightly trembling hand towards the lock. What is wrong with her? There's nothing to be nervous about. This certainly has to be the best case scenario for her.

The click of the lock doesn't bring any thoughts of relief for Lindsey anymore. She shakily turns the handle and cracks the door open. Gripping her phone and underwear, she sticks her arm out the door. Her things are swiftly snatched away.

"Pleasure doing business with you," the girl says from just outside.

Footsteps patter across the yard again as the trio leave with Lindsey's things. She is only left with shoes and stockings. They look so out of place on Lindsey's nude body.

Lindsey has plenty of time to consider her options now. Getting home would certainly be a pain without any covering. She could also check out the house. If one of the windows is open, she could get some clothing and be home free!
1321311322111121.title: The girls want Lindsey's underwear

choices: Get out the window and onto the roof
Dive for cover
13213113221111211.content:
Lindsey is sick of being the underdog. Getting into the house and getting redressed will put her back on the top of the food chain. She dishes out the pranks and embarrasses people, not the other way around.

However, no matter how confident Lindsey might act, that doesn't stop her from instinctively covering herself with her arms as much as possible.

The disgraced ninja reluctantly struts across the yard to the side of the house and starts searching for an unlocked entrance. She pulls on a couple of windows and begins jiggling the handle of a back door. The handle has give to it, but the door still refuses to open. Suddenly the handle twists with a click. Looks like it wasn't locked at all. It's just an old fussy door.

Lindsey takes one tentative step into the dark home, her black shoe impressing slightly into the living room carpet of the home she is invading. She has a light sense of apprehension in her chest. She may embarrass others in less than ethical ways, but something still feels very wrong about trespassing.

The door slowly eases back into place only requiring a slight nudge from Lindsey to click back shut. Time to search for clothes. Lindsey barely knows who the Stevensons are besides that they have children, so finding clothes will be a fairly random search.

Lindsey is as ignorant of the red flashing led next to her as she is of the family whose home she is in. She makes her way across the living room, still self-conscious enough to cover herself even in the safety of the walls surrounding her. Taking a glance down the hall, she decides to start at the top of the small two-story house and work her way down. Climbing the steps only acted to emphasize the awkwardness of Lindsey's lack of cover. Lindsey understands her embarrassment defies the logic of her hidden setting, but being functionally naked in someone else's house is bringing her so much anxiety. It will do her good to find something and get out of here.

Lindsey decides to pass on the office at the end of dark upstairs hallway and move straight to the door on her right. To her luck, it looks to be a girl's room. She immediately begins investigating the room. Opening a drawer, some shorts catch her eye. Sifting through them, she finds a nice start: a pair of black shorts.

She tentatively holds them in front of her hips, examining the size. The inhabitant of the room is apparently a tad bit larger than Lindsey, noted by the couple extra inches in the waistband of the shorts. Cutting her analysis short, a high shrill rings through Lindsey's skull. She claps her hands over her ears in response. What is that? An alarm?

Oh shit, that is an alarm. Lindsey's house has a similar system. If someone enters while it is armed, there are a couple minutes to enter a code before it goes off.

Lindsey has little time to shake off the ringing in her ears before she feels the steps of someone ascending the stairs. The presence of another person in the house shocks and confuses Lindsey. There isn't supposed to be anyone here!

Logic doesn't matter much now, Lindsey needs to do something. She doesn't even want to consider that she could be caught like this, or arrested... or arrested like this.
13213113221111211.title: Search for a way into the house

choices: Hide on the other side of the roof
Jump into the pool
132131132211112111.content:
Caught up in the moment, Lindsey rushes for the window. She flings it open, practically vaulting herself out the window. Sliding it shut behind her and crawling away from view, she sits on the rough shingled roof to catch her breath. She listens carefully through the ringing still clutching the black shorts she found.

Someone can be heard walking around the second floor opening doors. Lindsey eventually decides she can move a bit and slides the shorts onto her feet. Raising up her butt, she pulls them into place. She is thankful to be somewhat covered again.

Lindsey's not out of the fray yet. It isn't long before sirens can be heard outside the house. A policeman has come to the door to check on the situation. The alarm is finally stopped and Lindsey can hear two people talking inside the house.

She only becomes more concerned when the mysterious tenant and the officer enter the room beside her. She catches bits and pieces of the conversation inside explaining how this is the only room not right.

The bumping inside alerts Lindsey of the search going on inside. They are searching for her! It surely won't be long until they check the window.

Lindsey has just a moment to think things over. She can climb over the peak of the house. The other side of the roof may be more visible, but she might be able to get back inside. On the other hand, maybe Lindsey made a mistake hiding. Perhaps she should just jump into the pool and make a run for it. After all, running is about the only thing she's done right tonight.
132131132211112111.title: Get out the window and onto the roof

choices: Let bygones be bygones
Lindsey's costume looks good. Perhaps a trade is in order.
No dice. The girls are not interested in bargaining.
1321311322112.content:
As the spandex trio arrives at Lindsey's hiding place, Catwoman calls out, "We know you're here. Show your ugly face."

Lindsey knows she can't stay hidden for long, so she does her best by peaking her head over the shrubs. She attempts to reconcile, "Now, now, don't get so worked up. It was just a bit of Halloween fun."

"Yeah, fun for you maybe. But you've made Tina's night horrible! Atrocious!" Robin retorts.

Lindsey can tell she won't have an easy time appeasing this crowd. Social manipulation isn't really her strong suit, to begin with. She looks for some sympathy, "You should know that I didn't come away unscathed either. In an accident, I lost my shorts, and Tina took my top. So things seem more in Tina's favor here."

"Sounds like you got what was coming. Feel free to ruin your own night, but now that you've ruined our friend's night, you have to deal with us," Jess fires back with a glare.

"Let's be reasonable. How about this: I'll delete these pictures, you give me back my top, and go on enjoying the night having forgotten all about this," Lindsey bargains.

Riley's eyes gleam, "That doesn't seem like a very fair trade to me. What do you guys think?" She asks her friends.
1321311322112.title: Bargain with the girls

choices: Go after the girls to get revenge
Find an easier target
Something else
13213113221122.content:
"I think she should have to live down your own prank," Jess proposes.

"What do you mean?" Tina replies.

Jess points to the Ninja garb in Tina's hands, "I mean that you should leave as a ninja and our little prankster here should leave as Batgirl with her ass on display."

Tina doesn't seem to have any problems with the idea. Lindsey doesn't find it ideal, but it would get her out of the situation and she'd even still have a black costume.

"You here that philanderer?" Riley speaks at Lindsey, "Give us the rest of your costume, mask and all."

Lindsey complies, hiding her face in the bushes while she hands over her mask, shoes, stockings, and gloves. Riley gladly collects the items and speaks once more, "I said 'and all', this doesn't look like 'all' to me."

"You don't really expect me to hand over my underwear, do you? That's not part of my costume," Lindsey argues.

"If you're wearing it, it's part of your costume," Riley retorts.

Reluctantly, Lindsey hands over her underwear. Even in her cover, she feels the need to use her hands to protect her intimates from the cold October air. Shortly after, the Batgirl costume is tossed into the bushes.

"Now that this is over, I hope we never see the likes of your filth ever again or you'll be sorry," Riley speaks before the crew leaves.

Finally safe from the trio, Lindsey looks at the costume she's stuck with. She begins to work her way into the tight spandex bodysuit. The costume isn't bad. It even suits Lindsey pretty well if only a sizable hole wasn't exposing her rear end. Dawning her new mask, which is much less concealing, Lindsey begins to plan again.

She is 0-1 in success rate for the night and she isn't about to back down now. Now that she has the element of surprise back, maybe she should pay back a certain trio. Or maybe it's best to leave well enough alone and move onto easier targets.
13213113221122.title: Costume trade

choices: A haunted house
The cemetery
The movie theater
132131132211221.content:
No one embarrasses Lindsey and gets away with it. She gathers any leftover items she can find. Her scissors may be a bit bent, but a sharp edge should still be good for something. Her camera still seems to work even if it is scuffed up. As she picks up her leftover smoke bomb, noisemaker, and paint, she notices her night vision goggles in the bushes.

With everything tucked into her nifty Batgirl belt, she sneaks out of the bushes and starts her way down the street. For the most part, she can ignore other people as long as they don't get behind her.

After a couple of close calls, Lindsey catches up to her would-be victims. So far, all she knows is that Tina was waiting for her friends. They are a bit old for trick-or-treating, so where could they be going.

Lindsey carefully slinks behind the trio in the shadows. Every time she crouches out of sight, she feels her pale skin press against the open tear of her costume. She diligently follows the crew for nearly 20 minutes before they finally arrive at their destination.
132131132211221.title: Go after the girls to get revenge

choices: It's just her imagination
Something is wrong with her costume
132131132212.content:
Taking a closer look, Lindsey is mistaken much to her relief. Tina is definitely alone. If Tina had come with other people, who knows what she would have to do. If she sends the pictures out, she has no bargaining power, but would have no way to escape either.

Something still seems off about her though...
132131132212.title: There's something else wrong

choices: Lindsey can't hold up against Tina
Lindsey gets the upperhand
1321311322122.content:

Tina has leaped on top of Lindsey and is now trying to wrestle the phone out of her hands, stating her intentions, "I'm not letting you blackmail me you weak bitch!"

14.content:
Scares, spooks, and the supernatural. All of these played a key part in the origins of Halloween, where candies were offerings to the malevolent spirits of yore, and costumes served a vital role as an important camouflage. These ancient traditions have given way to the more relaxed Halloween of modern times, focusing more on candy and costumes as avenues of fun instead of fright. But sometimes the traditional ways are the best. For those looking for a true fright from zombies, ghouls, and all that goes bump in the night, haunted houses continue to serve this purpose.

Whether the house and its haunts are provided by willing volunteers, or merely an abandoned ruin with one too many ill rumors floating about, there are still plenty eager to prove their courage or to have the pants scared off of them, figuratively speaking of course. However, one unlucky person is going to lose a lot more than that during their haunting, adding a new fear that they are most assuredly unprepared for.

Who shall it be?

The timing and weather were perfect; the clear blue sky gave was to a starry night, complete with a full moon. The storm gave way to a chilling breeze- not cold enough to keep people inside, but cold enough to keep goosebumps on people's skin, even in between frights. With a rainless day, there was enough time for to hurriedly set up the annual 'Haunted Hedgemaze'

It took Stacey about an hour to ride down to the farmland with her friends. By the time she was stepping out of the car, the event was in full swing. People were walking into the hedge maze smiling and shaking with excitement, an leaving smiling and shaking with fear. There was a big truck coming by every so often to pick up visitors, taking them through the open barn on a 'Haunted Hay Ride'. And of course, the farm wasn't losing any time pushing their wares- areas were set up for carving pumpkins, bobbing for apples, etc.

And the event wouldn't be complete without the costumes- visitors were encouraged to dress for the occasion by getting a discounted entry fee. Stacey's costume might not have been the most outlandish, or the most original, but she was still happy with it. A week and a half ago, if you told Chris that he'd be skulking around a haunted house, dressed in thick clothes and waiting for people to jump out and terrify, he wouldn't have believed you. Not that the idea didn't sound fun, as a joke, but he doubted he'd get many opportunities, even if it was October. No, Chris wasn't used to participating in stuff like that, or in most things in general, aside from hanging out with some friends every now and again.

But then one of his friends, Harriet, told him about this Haunted House/Halloween Fair thing the town was running. Now, Chris didn't go to a lot of fairs, but Halloween was a fun time of the year, so it caught Chris's attention. Harriet was working there as a makeup artist; both at a face-painting booth for the kids, and also helping the volunteers in the haunted house get all ghouled-up to do their jobs. She told him that they needed another volunteer or two, and Chris, being a decently tall, decently fit guy with a lot of free time, fit the bill perfectly!

And so, a couple times a week, with a few more as it got closer to Halloween, Chris showed up at the Town Manor. It was a big building, made to be a home a long time ago, but some things happened, a bunch of legal stuff that no one really bothered looking into, and it sort of just ended up being owned by the town. So, with the decent amount of land surrounding the house itself, the township used it a couple times a year for big public events. When October came around, they spookified the place, and held a big fair around it.

All in all, it wasn't a bad deal. The clothes were a little itchy, not to mention tight in a few... uncomfortable places, and he was spending a lot of time in dusty cramped spaces helping to set up the decorations and mechanical scares, but it was all in good fun, and he was excited for the night itself. All it really came down to was the costume and the place he'd be hiding. He was excited to be...

Chris had peeked into the attic when they were deciding who was going to be scaring people where, and he loved it! It was easily the scariest room in the house, with a really naturally spooky atmosphere. In a big house like this, it was nice and spacious too, for an attic. Chris was surprised when no else wanted to take that spot. When he took a better look at the room, having already volunteered to cover that room, he suddenly understood why.

A lot of effort was going into making the house look decrepit and haunted. The attic didn't take nearly as much effort to decorate, because it was already ancient and broken down. It was already cluttered, dark, full of old cracked wood and creaky floorboards. Most of the work went into make it less scary for the sake of people's safety; things like sanding down splintery wood, and clearing any loose nails that they could find. Still, aside from the cobwebs and dust, Chris got over his problems with the room pretty quickly once he heard how he'd be scaring people.

Harriet showed him his costume the night before the Halloween Fair opened for business. It was a heavy, gray bodysuit, with a bunch of tattered strips of white fabric hanging off of it. The mask it came with was all gray, with a jagged pair of eye holes and a mouth torn in, with a layer of black, see through material that would hide his eyes and keep the illusion while allowing him to see out. The idea was that he would hide up in the rafters, and jump down to scare anybody who walked that far into the attic. It sounded fun to him; it was easy enough to get back up, even if the creaking wood made him a little nervous every time he practiced...

So, finally, the big night came, and a huge crowd was running around the property, playing games, drinking cider, bobbing for apples; all the Halloween standards. They had set up a changing tent behind the house for the volunteers to use; the body suit was heavy enough that wearing more than a pair of boxers underneath sounded like Hell, so he shoved his street clothes into a backpack and left it in the tent.

The performers had all gotten into their positions, just as a line had started outside the main doors. Chris couldn't wait... except he was going to have to. Turns out, in a two story building with a basement and an attic, people are going to take a while to work their way up that far.

That's what I get for choosing the spot farthest from the entrance, he thought to himself. He could feel his legs falling asleep under his weight, crouched up on the rafter as he was. He was considering finding a better, more comfortable spot to pop out from when he heard the attic door open. He waited; there were a number of footsteps traveling across the room, and the whining of the floorboards was only getting louder as whoever it was got closer. Finally, Chris could hear whispering, just in front of where he would drop down. He took a deep breath, before shoving off the rafter!

14433.content:
"That could've gone better," Harriet grumbled, lying face-down in the overgrown grass on the other side of the Smith mansion fence. It was all going so smoothly just minutes before...

---

While the mansion was abandoned enough that there were no guards or groundskeepers to worry about, there was a tall, stone wall lined with spikes on top surrounding the grounds. The only way in was a metal gate which was locked by a metal lock wrapped with heavy chains that had long since rusted, preventing normal access.

Not one to be stopped by total lockdown, however, Harriet had quickly found her method of entry: a tall tree outside the fence that had a branch overlooking the grounds. Climbing the tree was simple enough, even with her old lantern hanging on her hip, but the branches were covered in thorns, which picked all over her body and pulled at her costume: a japanese schoolgirl uniform worn by the heroine of a recent anime. She liked the character well enough and had decided on the costume for maneuverability (as well as appreciating how she looked in it,) but had she had known that there would be so many thorns, Harriet probably would've dressed in the character's casual clothes instead, which offered a bit more coverage. At least there was a glove as part of the costume that offered at least some protection.

Soon enough, Harriet made it to the end with only a few tears along her costume. She was now above and slightly in front of the wall. It would be a bit of a drop, but nothing she wasn't prepared for. Unhooking the lantern from her skirt, Harriet tossed it over the wall into the yard, hearing a subdued rustle as it landed. "Should be safe," she said to herself as she readied her jump and leapt.

Unfortunately, when rocked back and forth to prepare for her leap, her skirt had gotten snagged and hooked onto a thorny branch on the upper side of the one she was on, slightly behind her. The branch held strong as Harriet leapt forward, causing her to leap out of her own skirt!

"Ah?" she uttered as she felt the tug, followed by fabric moving down her legs.

But Harriet had no time to worry about her skirt, that tug had lowered her speed, setting her on a crash course for the top of the wall and its sharp, pointy spikes. Harriet flinched and closed her eyes, bracing herself for the worst.

But, miraculously, it was only the sides of her costume the got impaled by the spikes, with her landing right in the middle, leaning over the edge of the wall. Harriet sighed in relief, only for her costume to give way again, sending her spilling out of the shirt and into the lawn.

---

Picking herself up off of the ground, Harriet saw her lantern a few feet in front of her. Scooping up the lantern, she turned back to her shirt, stuck on the spikes too high for her to reach. She was shocked and disgusted to see that it was the shoulder seams that had given way completely, which hadn't been damaged at all during her climb earlier. "Last time I go with that costume maker," she said, as she turned toward the mansion, now wearing only her personal blue-and-white striped bra and panties, as well as the costume glove, shoes, and socks.

Now, being stripped to her underwear just as her adventure was beginning probably should have been a warning sign, but Harriet wasn't too concerned. First, this was an abandoned mansion, there shouldn't be anyone besides her there at this time of night. Second, and more importantly, walking around in her underwear should be way more scarier than walking around fully clothed. She could swear that with more of her skin exposed to the elements, her senses were heightened too. The chill of the night air, the silence and dread of the old mansion, the wetness of the rain...

"What?" Harriet gasped. It was suddenly starting to rain! When did that happen? Doubling her pace, she booked it up the rest of the overgrown path to the front door of the mansion. Seeing no locks or bars like the front gate, Harriet tugged on the handle. The door opened up with a loud creak, and Harriet quickly dashed inside, shutting the door behind her.

"Phew," Harriet sighed, catching her breath. Realizing that it was very dark inside the mansion, Harriet brought forth her lantern to look at her surroundings.

She was in a foyer, with stairs going up and down in front of her and rooms off to the sides. She could see that there was a second and third floor that could be reached by going up, but the light beam wasn't strong enough to see any further. Aside from her somewhat narrow light beam, everything else was shrouded in darkness.

Harriet smiled, her heartbeat quickening. An entire old mansion all to herself. Where to begin?

*Achoo!*

That's right, she was soaked! Her short hair would dry out soon enough, but she could feel her damp underwear clinging to her body. She needed to take care of this problem first before she could enjoy the frights of this mansion, but there was no way she was going to be walking around a place like this naked!

Harriet shivered, looking back and forth at her available paths. There was no way she would be going to the basement first, that's where the scariest stuff would be, after all. What she needed to do instead was to explore...

Amy luxuriated in the shower, feeling the warm water wash over her body. She sighed. She'd really made the right choice to stay home tonight! Little did she know, of course, that tonight would be one of the most humiliating experiences of her life. She was suddenly jerked out of her thoughts by the sound of footsteps outside the bathroom, in the hallway. Amy's heart stopped. Who was there? Her family were all out, so it couldn't be them. A burglar, maybe? But why would they be out on the most crowded night of the year? Still hardly daring to breathe, Amy turned the water off and called out, placing her arms over her chest as the water began to cool.

"Hello! Is someone there?"

The silence seemed to stretch for an eternity, then an answer came.

"Oh, yeah, hi Amy. It's me, Trent. Blake spilled some punch on my ghost costume at the party-"

"Hey! It was an accident!" came the sound of Blake, Trent's friend.

"Yeah, you must have been too distracted by Jessica." said another of Trent's friends. Tony? Trevor? Amy couldn't remember.

Trent ignored the other two. "-So we came back to get another one. Do you know where my zombie from last year is?"

"I think you stuffed it under your bed. Y'know, like all the others." Amy called with an eye roll.

"Oh yeah! Thanks sis." Trent called back.

Amy let out a sigh of relief. Just her idiot younger brother and his dumb friends (although 'lackeys' might have been a better word). Nothing to worry herself about. In fact, she thought with a smile, this was pretty good. It gave her a reason to stay in the shower for longer. She'd left her clothes outside the door, and she wasn't about to go walking out in front of Trent's friends in just a towel. All was ... wait. Amy suddenly remembered. Her clothes were outside the door, including the pair of embarrassing heart panties she'd been wearing. Trent and his friends hadn't seen them yet, otherwise they'd already be making fun of her, but they might notice any minute! She'd die of shame if they did! What could she do? An idea suddenly occurred to her.

"Hey Trent, since you're putting your costume in the washing machine, could you stick my clothes in there, too? I was going to after my shower, but if you're going anyway...?"

"Absolutes, sis. Don't worry about it." came Trent's reply.

"Thanks!" Amy called, confident her brother wouldn't notice the panties bundled up in his costume, and turned the water back on.

On the other side of the door, Trent turned to his two friends and whispered to them, his voice hidden to his sister by the water.

"Alright guys, I think we might have another shot at this. After you-" he nodded to Travis, "-let her know we were here by bounding along the hallway, I thought the plan was over. But, ever the genius, I've only gone and come up with another."

The two others perked up.
"Alright!" whispered back Travis, "Yeah, sorry for being loud, just excited, I guess."
"Y'didn't have to throw me under the bus, though," said Blake, "You made me sound like a buffoon, spilling drinks on people. Your sister'll think I'm an idiot!"
"Look Blake," Trent said "Firstly, you are an idiot. Secondly, trust me, by the time tonight's over, you won't be the one looking stupid."
"Speaking of," Travis said, "What's the new plan?"
"Glad you asked," Trent said with a smirk. "Peeking is off, but I have another great idea. First, we just need to..."
14531211.title: Barge in during Amy's shower before bedtime

145331.content:
Lauren is a 23 years old woman. She has a slim body, medium sized breast, a cute little bottom, long brown hair always tied in a ponytail, and green eyes. As a nerdy girl she has rather pale skin and wear half frame glasses on her nose.

On the border of her town there is a old abandonned manor, which is supposed to be haunted. During this halloween night, Lauren decides to go there and investigate, just to proove that "haunted house" is only rumors.

She take a bag with a flashlight and a cutting pliers in it. She's dressed in a dark grey tank top under a black jacket and a black jeans with black sneakers. She goes out of her house and heads to the manor.

Once in front of the manor she looked around, the landscape is creepy. Everything seems dead here, the tree don't have leaves, the grass has a brownish color. The manor is in bad condition, it's almost a ruin. Every window are broken, a lot of shutters are missing. Through the window she can see ripped curtains.

On the background of the house she can see a greenhouse filled with unkempt plants, the glasses are broken and some wines grown out of the greenhouse. She also can see a kind of gravestone with the door half open.

The manor is surrounded by a metal fence with spikes, there is a gate but it's closed with a chain and a padlock. A sign is on the gate "Hazardous area, do not enter!"

She shivers "Well, that's rather scray, but, ghost doesn't exist in reality".

She climbs the fence

She lift up her hands and the sleeves of her jacket slide off her arms, letting her landing to the ground. Without het jacket the pink straps of her bra can be seen on her shoulders. She pulls the hemline of her top back over her pants and picks up her bag on the ground.
